body.name: Gas One Dual Fuel Portable Stove 15,000BTU With Brass Burner Head, Dual Spiral Flame Gas Stove - Patent Pending
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 5 hrs 51 mins
features: Unparalleled 15,000 BTU Output: Market-leading performance, compatible with both 8oz camping fuel and propane fuel (Note: Fuel is not included). Operates efficiently with a single 8oz camping fuel cartridge or a 16.4oz (1lb) propane cylinder (Propane adapter included), ensuring versatility and convenience for all outdoor cooking needs.
Advanced Piezo-Electric Ignition System: Offers a seamless, matchless ignition by eliminating the need for manual lighting, enhancing ease of use and safety in outdoor environments.

User-Friendly Design: The GS-3900PB stove is engineered for simplicity, featuring an adjustable heat dial and piezo-electric ignition for effortless operation. Ideal for camping, backpacking, and emergency preparedness, it provides reliability and ease under any conditions.
Enhanced Safety Mechanisms: Equipped with a built-in pressure sensor cartridge ejection system and a gas flow cut-off mechanism to ensure user safety and operational security at all times.

Robust Windblocker Protection: Incorporates a heavy-duty Windblocker on all four corners of the burner head to prevent flame extinguishment by wind, guaranteeing consistent performance in various outdoor conditions.

Portable with Protective Carrying Case: Comes with a durable carrying case for convenient transport and storage, making it the perfect companion for adventurers seeking both portability and protection.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Checks all the boxes.
reviews.reviewText: Packaging was very good, the case is lightweight but effective and I appreciate that it makes the entire assembly easy to carry, setup was a breeze and it works perfectly. The stove itself is of sturdy construction. Small propane canisters can be purchased from Home Depot for a good price. Will eventually get the 20 lb and the attachment for refills (both at Home Depot as well). There is no waste or gas residue when using except when you disconnect the fuel canister, there might be a little bit of a leak as you do that. But it's completely practical to use this inside the house on an appropriate counter or stovetop with ventilation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bye bye electric stove
reviews.reviewText: Works great it heats up super fast, huge difference between this and my old electric one where I had to wait around 5 minutes just to heat up the pan. Now it takes me less than a minute to heat it up and even hotter.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for car camping
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for a car camping trip and it worked fantastically. The only hiccup was when I had very strong winds camping near the beach and it struggled a little. But I used the case as a wind block and it worked great again. Great little stove.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Finished our 2nd week camping with this stove and it worked great. Used 1lb propane canister and it worked well.I’m trying this out vs a 2 burner camp stove, no question the flame is smaller on this vs the blowtorch on the other. The stove proved I don’t need max flame to cook. It seems efficient, so gas use seemed less with this stove.Seems well constructed, easy to clean, a win. Achieved the goal to reduce the use of space with a good quality stove. Would recommend buying the windscreen, it fits nicely in the stoves case and does it’s job in windy conditions

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a gas burning stove that gave out more powerful flames The product was as suspected when it was lit. It had a very nice burn little more flames than other types of burners and put out more heat.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I will be purchasing a second one. So Nice!
reviews.reviewText: I had to hook this up as soon as I got it. Well packaged, easy assembly, simple to use with great btu. This double flame supplies great even cooking. The smooth dial allows a very high flame as well as a reasonable low flame. I had planned to get a Coleman double burner, but I am just getting another one of these. Highly recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice and portable burner.
reviews.reviewText: Wish it came with conversion for large tanks of propane.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Took it on a two day camping trip and it worked out well. Light weight, lights easy, heats well. Overall I’m happy with it. Case is a little cheesy but I’m sure it will last and be fine. I don’t toss my stuff around too hard so it should last a while. Used it with a Lodge griddle/grill and it worked great. For the cost I’d say it’s a keeper! I also have a 10k btu gas one stove and the built in wind screen on this one seems to help. Had some wind and no flame out so that’s a plus. I’ll pick up a folding wind screen just to have it. Appears well made and should last a while. I wouldn’t hesitate to buy another.
good for price; difficult to regulate low heat
Im happy to work with my wok now
